page.title: 06Oddington
page.content: This little village of about 16 houses is situated on the edge of Otmoor on the Western side close to the New River Ray, a man made cut. There is a manor house,a garage run by a Mr Franklin (very much a local name)who not only undertakes repairs but also sells petrol,and a small church.One of the inhabitants,a Mr Rawlins,has an observatory in his garden.There are several farms in the area,all based on the village.In the churchyard there lies buried a Maori Princess called Papakura who was married to one of the local gentry and lived at Oddington Grange nearby. She caused a memorial to be erected inside the church to the Maori dead of the 1914-18 war.The memorial was carved in New Zealand by Maori craftsmen and stands in the church to this day.
